alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 21 at 7:09AM CST until November 21 at 11:15AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Jackson County in northeastern Alabama... * Until 1115 AM CST. * At 709 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Skyline, Pleasant Groves, Hytop, Princeton, Hollytree, Trenton and Garth. This includes the following streams and drainages... Evans Creek, Williams Creek, Dry Creek, Robinson Creek, Talkington Branch, Clear Creek, Larkin Fork, Neely Branch, Houston Branch, Big Coon Creek, Pole Branch, Mud Creek, Crow Creek, Paint Rock River, Lick Fork, Hurricane Creek, Blue Spring Creek, Mancher Creek, Guess Creek, Little Dry Creek and Little Coon Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
